answers.author: Donald Gloo
answers.text:
The City of Racine, WI, along with two neighboring communities, are all considering ordinances that would permit "backyard" chickens.  To my knowledge, none have passed yet, and the most recent activity on the topic was a presentation to the Racine Board of Health by a livestock expert from Madison, WI.  I will post again if any of the ordinances are passed.  You might also set up a Google alert for "chickens site:journaltimes.com".
On a related note, there is a house not far from where I live (in Wisconsin) that advertises "fresh eggs" most of the time.  Occasionally, however, the "fresh eggs" sign is replaced by one that says "roasters for sale".  ;-)

author: Evelina Moulder
text: In response to residents' requests to raise egg-laying chickens on their property, several local governments, including Durham, NC, have passed ordinances allowing chickens on residential property under certain conditions.  If your local government has passed such an ordinance, please share it by posting it in as an attachment in your response. Thank you.
title: Does your local government have an ordinance permitting chickens on residential property?
